sentences.en: Both clay and sandstone are unstable rock formations.
sentences.cn: 黏土和砂岩都是不牢固的岩石构造。

sentences.en: Coleridge was also a highly unstable person.
sentences.cn: 科尔里奇还是个情绪非常不稳定的人。

sentences.en: David's mother was unstable and moody.
sentences.cn: 戴维的妈妈情绪不稳定，心情也不好。

sentences.en: Europe had become infinitely more unstable and fragmented.
sentences.cn: 欧洲已经变得相当不稳定，也越来越分化。

sentences.en: He was the most unstable kind of fool I had ever seen.
sentences.cn: 他是我所遇见过的最反复无常的傻瓜.

sentences.en: Her emotions were always as unstable as the light winds of April.
sentences.cn: 她的感情总是象四月的无定准的轻风一样.

sentences.en: She was physically delicate and psy-chologically unstable.
sentences.cn: 她身体孱弱，心理上也不够稳定。

sentences.en: The erratic fluctuation of market prices is in consequence of unstable economy.
sentences.cn: 经济波动致使市场物价忽起忽落。

sentences.en: The political situation is still very unstable.
The political situation remains highly unstable.
The situation is unstable and potentially dangerous.
sentences.cn: 情况不稳定，可能有危险。

sentences.en: This bookcase is too unstable to hold so many books.
sentences.cn: 这书橱很不结实,装不了这么多书.

words.tran_cn: 不稳定的；动荡的；易变的

phrases.tran_cn: 不稳定斜坡，不稳定边坡；不稳坡

trans.tran_cn: 不稳固的，不坚定的，易变的，反复无常的
trans.tran_en: likely to change sud­denly and become worse
